title.narrative: Synthesis of Adaptation Research on Coastal and Delta Areas
Synthèse de la recherche sur l'adaptation dans les zones côtières et les deltas

description.narrative:
IDRC's Climate Change and Water (CCW) program recognizes that populations living in coastal areas, especially large coastal cities, are particularly vulnerable to climate change impacts, including storm surges and flooding, coastal erosion, groundwater salinization, and sea level rise. The program's diverse portfolio includes 23 research projects focusing (in part) on the theme of coastal vulnerability. While individual projects are yielding important findings, it is unclear how the projects as a group contribute to broader scholarship, practice, and policy on adaptation in coastal zones.
This research support project will consolidate research results through two related activities: a workshop with CCW grantees and an external evaluation. It aims to assess and synthesize the results of IDRC-funded research on coastal vulnerability in order to improve understanding of climate change impacts in vulnerable coastal and estuarine areas. More specifically, its objectives include: -to compile and assess research results from a range of projects on coastal and estuarine areas; -to evaluate the contribution of IDRC-funded research to the literature on adaptation to climate change in coastal and estuarine areas; -to assess the strength and quality of the research methods used in IDRC-supported projects; and, -to share the findings using IDRC's communication vehicles and other approaches.
Selected CCW-funded researchers will participate in a synthesis workshop in Belem do Para, Brazil, in October 2013. Criteria for selection includes project maturity, projects with results to share, and projects focused on vulnerability in coastal, estuary, and delta ecosystems. The workshop will focus on findings related to climate stressors and impacts in coastal zones, research methodologies, and results from tested adaptation strategies. The workshop's main output will be a synthesis report on significant findings from CCW-funded research.
IDRC will also commission an external evaluation to assess the results of CCW-funded work on coastal vulnerability. The evaluation will also consider the extent to which projects have achieved results related to CCW program-level outcomes.
This effort is part of CCW's broader synthesis efforts, including six activities organized by theme, methodology, and region. The workshop and evaluation outputs are expected to be used to draft the final prospectus report. They will also be used to inform the final program evaluation and ongoing and future programming on climate change adaptation.
